TextView.android:text: Loading Please Wait .... Task You have been hired by a small IT consulting company and put on a project that involves the development of a web-based information system. The company has hired you, along with several other new employees, to assist them on projects involving frameworks and design patterns they are unfamiliar with. The project you have joined is in the inception phase. A constraint of the project is that the system must be developed using the ASP.net core MVC framework. The current team is unfamiliar with this framework and design pattern and have brought you onto the project to help. The project team know you have experience with the MVC design pattern and the ASP.net core environment. They want you to assist on the project and to teach them about the design pattern and framework. Instructions You will work with a team of two (2) other new employees who also have experience with ASP.net core and MVC. You and your team will need to prepare a document that provides an overview of the MVC design pattern, explains the ASP.net core MVC functionality, and cover some implementation features of the ASP.net core MVC framework. You and your team will also need to develop a prototype of an ASP.net core MVC system that practically demonstrates the basic functionality of the framework and outlines any features you mention. The guideline document will need to include a cover page and two main sections. The first section should provide an overview of the MVC design pattern and explain how the MVC design pattern works. The second section should then explain various concepts of the ASP.net core MVC framework. The explanations contained in the second section should link to the prototype you and your team have developed for this assignment. The system should be used to demonstrate and justify the concepts you explain. Refer to the breakdown below for the requirements of each component. SECTION 2: ASP.NET CORE MVC (70 MARKS) Each team will need to develop a custom ASP.net core MVC system that is used to demonstrate and explain the concepts below. Written explanations need to be provided in the document and should include either references to the developed system or screen shots of the system. The system will be opened and examined at the same time that the document is marked. Marks will be deducted when written explanations in the document do not correspond with the developed system. The written explanations should be referenced appropriately.
